page.title: 02ATTITUDES TO RELIGION
page.content: There are five{churches}on the eastern outskirts of Tiverton, most of which are concentrated on the western side near the town centre. When we were conducting our survey, the people who were interviewed were mainly reluctant to talk about religion. Even when asked general questions their{attitude}was one of unease. In our survey, most people belonged to the{Church of England;}some were non-conformist, belonging to the {Baptist or Methodist}denominations; a very small proportion were{Roman {Catholic.}Our area is not a multi-faith area as we have a very small immigrant population; we have no temples or mosques. Generally, though, the people who were interviewed held no strong beliefs about religion.
